intro: Macroglena meifolia, commonly known as the meadow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, preferring partial shade to full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers range from white to pale blue. Macroglena meifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
